WorkItem.Description: I searched through the Discussions and found 1 other post from feb mentioning this but it seams that agi for ret paladins (or maybe paladins in general) is being calculated at 62.5 AGI per 1% crit instead of 52.083333 AGI per 1% crit like its meant to be. Don't know if it is already known so i thought i would point it out. The post also mentioned that he was able to change his local version of RAWR to the right ratio. if someone could tell me how to do that it would be much appreciated.

Comments.Message: Actually it seams to be more than just Agi....when i'm completely naked ingame while speced ret i have almost 5% (4.79) more crit than RAWR says a naked BE paladin should have while speced ret
Against boss level mobs you have a 4.8% reduced chance to crit. To compare against character sheet stats set the target level to 80.
well now i feel like a retard....thanks for the quick response
